Posts.Content: New here. I'm 58 and have stage 2a. Lump on right breast was invasive carcinoma, mastectomy and 19 nodes taken out and all were negative. My youngest brother died of colon cancer at 54, other younger brother had prostate cancer and lung cancer, died of pulmonary embolism, father died at 63 of pancreatic cancer-- all were heavy heavy smokers. i quit 12 years ago. Start chemo in 2 weeks. Everything points to beating it, from what I've read. haven't met another guy with this breast cancer yet. mcather
Posts.Title: Male breast cancer - please share your stories

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by fighterm I was surprised that they did not take out some of lymph nodes in the vicinity. Are you at a good place getting treatments where docs deal with a lot of breast cancers? I don't know much about male vs female variants. But I know that cancer can grow in any cells that have DNA. They did take out 19 lymph nodes and all were clean. mcather
